org.kiji.schema
Class PutLocalApiWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.KijiDataWriter
      org.kiji.schema.WrappedDataWriter<WRAPPER,DATUM>
          org.kiji.schema.impl.LocalApiWriter<PutWrapper,Put>
              org.kiji.schema.PutLocalApiWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class PutLocalApiWriter
extends LocalApiWriter<PutWrapper,Put>

A Kiji data writer that outputs writes to the local Kiji table using the Kiji java API.

          Describes the options that can be configured on the PutLocalApiWriter.

Method Detail

doWrite

protected void doWrite(Put wrapped)
                throws IOException
Writes a value at the current timestamp and reports progress.

All other write methods of Kiji data writers delegate to this method. Subclasses should override this method to implement desired write functionality.

Specified by:
doWrite in class WrappedDataWriter<PutWrapper,Put>
Parameters:
wrapped - The wrapped data to write out.
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem writing.

flush

public void flush()
           throws InterruptedException,
                  IOException
Performs any writes that have been buffered.

Overrides:
flush in class WrappedDataWriter<PutWrapper,Put>
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while writing.
IOException - If there is a problem writing.
